geotorch.grassmannian module¶

class geotorch.grassmannian.Grassmannian(size, triv='expm')[source]¶

Bases: geotorch.manifold.Fibration

Implement everything as the fibration St(n,k) -> Gr(n,k) G(n,k) iso St(n,k) / O(k)

property orig_dim¶
class geotorch.manifold.EmbeddedManifold(dimensions, size)[source]¶

Bases: geotorch.manifold.AbstractManifold

forward(X)[source]¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

projection(X)[source]¶

Parametrizes the manifold in terms of a projection from the ambient space :param X: A tensor in the ambient space :type X: torch.nn.Tensor

Returns

A tensor on the manifold

Return type

tensor (torch.nn.Tensor)

Note

This function should be surjective, otherwise not all the manifold will be explored

trivialization(X, B)[source]¶

Parametrizes the manifold in terms of a tangent space :param X: A tensor, usually living in T_B M :type X: torch.nn.Tensor :param B: Point on M at whose tangent space we are trivializing :type B: torch.nn.Tensor

Returns

A tensor on the manifold

Return type

tensor (torch.nn.Tensor)

Note

This function should be surjective, otherwise not all the manifold will be explored

chain(parametrization)[source]¶

It modifies the current parametrization, parametrizing the original tensor in terms of the new parametrization

The original parametrization is modified after chain is applied to it

Parameters

parametrization (nn.Parametrization) – the parametrization to be chained

Returns

The original module with the parametrization module appended to it

Return type

Module

trivializations = {'cayley': <function cayley_map>, 'expm': <function expm>}¶
uniform_init_()[source]¶
geotorch.so.cayley_map(X)[source]¶
geotorch.so.torus_init_(tensor, init_=None, triv=<function expm>)[source]¶

Samples the 2D input tensor as a block-diagonal skew-symmetric matrix which is skew-symmetric in the main diagonal. The blocks are of the form \(\begin{pmatrix} 0 & b \\ -b & 0\end{pmatrix}\) where \(b\) is distributed according to init_. Then it is projected to the manifold using triv.

Parameters

  • tensor (torch.nn.Tensor) – a 2-dimensional tensor

  • init_ – Optional. A function that takes a tensor and fills it in place according to some distribution. Default: \(\mathcal{U}(-\pi, \pi)\)

  • triv – Optional. A function that maps skew-symmetric matrices to orthogonal matrices.

geotorch.so.uniform_init_(tensor)[source]¶

Fills the input Tensor with an orthogonal matrix. The matrix will have positive determinant. The input tensor must have at least 2 dimensions, and for tensors with more than 2 dimensions the first dimensions are treated as batch dimensions.

Parameters

tensor (torch.nn.Tensor) – a 2-dimensional tensor or a batch of them
